intro: Knowltonia transvaalensis var. pottiana, commonly known as the Transvaal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant produces showy, clustered blooms during the summer months, making it a popular ornamental species. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, and it is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens. Its botanical features make it a distinctive addition to botanical collections and horticultural displays.
